title: Violent Passions: Edvard Munch and Alban Berg
description: This exhibit was originally mounted in Chicago in order to coincide with the Chicago Lyric Opera’s opening of Alban Berg’s opera Wozzeck. The opera’s themes of jealousy and insanity translated through the art of Munch, as some of his most visceral pieces such as The Kiss (1897/98) and The Vampire (1895) were shown in this exhibit. Several of Munch’s paintings and lithographs were featured, as he is widely acknowledged to be a master printmaker of Western art. Like Berg’s Wozzeck, Munch’s work plays with themes of angst, despair and sexual jealousy that inspires a sense of violence.
